item.title: All-Day Object Tracking for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle
ReCF: Exploiting Response Reasoning for Correlation Filters in Real-Time UAV Tracking
item.description: Main difference between the proposed ReCF and SRDCF.

item.title: Multi-Regularized Correlation Filter for UAV Tracking and Self-Localization
item.description: Overall flowchart of the proposed MRCF.

item.title: Correlation Filters for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle-Based Aerial Tracking: A Review and Experimental Evaluation
item.description: General tracking structure of DCF-based methods onboard the UAV platform, which can be divided into the training stage, model update, and detection stage.

item.title: ADTrack: Target-Aware Dual Filter Learning for Real-Time Anti-Dark UAV Tracking
item.description: Overall framework of the proposed ADTrack. ADTrack includes 3 stages: pretreatment, training, and detection, which are marked out by boxes in different colors. Dual filters, i.e., context filter and target-focused filter, training and detection follow routes in different colors. It can be seen that the final response shaded noises in context response, which indicates the validity of proposed dual filter.

item.title: Mutation Sensitive Correlation Filter for Real-Time UAV Tracking with Adaptive Hybrid Label
item.description: Tracking procedure of the proposed MSCF tracker. Dashed boxes denote the variables to be solved in the main regression. As MTF in the red box is generated from search region in frame k, it is applied to adjust the altitude value of the cruciform pedestal.

item.title: Disruptor-Aware Interval-Based Response Inconsistency for Correlation Filters in Real-Time Aerial Tracking
item.description: Tracking procedure of the proposed IBRI tracker in the k-th frame. Historical interval responses are incorporated into the filter training phase after denoising by a novel disruptor-aware scheme based on response bucketing.

item.title: Learning Temporary Block-Based Bidirectional Incongruity-Aware Correlation Filters for Efficient UAV Object Tracking
item.description: A flowchart of the proposed TB-BiCF tracker.

item.title: Towards Robust Visual Tracking for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle with Tri-Attentional Correlation Filters
item.description: The main workflow of the TACF tracker.

item.title: Object Saliency-Aware Dual Regularized Correlation Filter for Real-Time Aerial Tracking
item.description: Comparison between the tracking pipeline of the baseline SRDCF tracker and the proposed DRCF tracker.

item.title: BiCF: Learning Bidirectional Incongruity-Aware Correlation Filter for Efficient UAV Object Tracking
item.description: Comparison between discriminative correlation filter (DCF) and the proposed BiCF tracker

item.title: Training-Set Distillation for Real-Time UAV Object Tracking
item.description: Comparison between our TSD tracker with the baseline BACF tracker

item.title: Correlation Filter-Based Visual Tracking for UAV with Online Multi-Feature Learning
item.description: Fig. 1 Main structure of the proposed tracking approach.

Fuling Lin received his B.Eng. degree and M.Sc. degree in mechanical engineering from Tongji University, Shanghai, China, in 2019 and 2022, respectively. He is currently pursuing the PhD degree in mechanical engineering at HongKong University (HKU), China.
